revised_title: Hourly Observations of Magnetic Declination in the Arctic Sea
tldr: This article discusses the results of hourly observations of the magnetic declination made by Sir Francis Leopold McClintock and his team in the Arctic Sea during the winter of 1858-59. The observations were compared with those made by Captain Rochfort Maguire in 1852, 1853, and 1854 at Point Barrow. The study aimed to understand the periodical laws of magnetic disturbances at different locations and their impact on navigation and geographical physics.
